newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan January industrial output up 6.01 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan January industrial output up 6.01 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Taiwan's industrial output rose 6.01 percent in January compared to January 1996, the economics ministry said on Tuesday.
The official January industrial output figure was nearly a full percentage point higher than the average forecast of 5.02 that resulted from a February 14 Reuters Poll of Taiwan economists.
The ministry attributed the high output to steady growth in the manufacturing industry.
The manufacturing index, including metals, machinery, information electronics, chemical and consumer products, rose 6.82 percent in January from the same month in 1996.
Real estate and construction industry output fell 12.21 percent from a year earlier. Mining industry output was down 5.16 percent compared with a year ago.
